data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Cleanup of camera_info_manager_py. (#340)

1. Remove the dead CMakeLists.txt.bak
2. Add in a pytest.ini, mostly so the tests have a timeout.
3. Remove rosdoc.yaml, which only applies to ROS 1.
4. Add in a setup.cfg so scripts go to the correct location.
5. Add in additional tests.
6. Change the dependencies to be exec_depend (since this is a Python
   package).

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@gmail.com>

data.author: Chris Lalancette

so drop the workflow.

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Update image_common to C++17. (#267)

The main reason to do this is so that we can compile image_common
with the clang static analyzer.  As of clang++-14 (what is in
Ubuntu 22.04), the default still seems to be C++14, so we need
to specify C++17 so that new things in the rclcpp headers work
properly.

Further, due to reasons I don't fully understand, I needed to
set CMAKE_CXX_STANDARD_REQUIRED in order for clang to really use
that version.  So set this as well.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Rebecca Butler
data.message:
Image transport tutorial (#197)

Fixes #193

This PR ports the existing image_transport tutorials from ROS 1 to ROS 2.

The tutorial code now lives in a dedicated image_transport_tutorial package. The content from http://wiki.ros.org/image_transport/Tutorials is presented in the README and has been updated to work for ROS 2.

Signed-off-by: Rebecca Butler <rebecca@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Ivan Santiago Paunovic
data.message:
Fix SimpleSubscriberPlugin (#195)

* * [SimpleSubscriberPlugin] Do not override the subscribeImpl method taking a rclcpp::SubscriptionOptions object.
  Plugins that were not overriding it before won't notice that they have to be update.

* Allocate a SimpleSubscriberPlugin::Impl on construction.

Signed-off-by: Ivan Santiago Paunovic <ivanpauno@ekumenlabs.com>

* Revert changes so code looks closer than the original one

Signed-off-by: Ivan Santiago Paunovic <ivanpauno@ekumenlabs.com>

* * Add subscribeImplWithOptions() helper method to SimpleSubscriberPlugin.
* Override subscribeImpl() method taking a rclcpp::SubscriptionOptions in all classes inheriting from SimpleSubscriberPlugin.

Signed-off-by: Ivan Santiago Paunovic <ivanpauno@ekumenlabs.com>

* Fix leaky windows workaround for getenv
* Fixes to ament dependencies.

* Address reviewer feedback

* Change to new style remapping
* Move dllimport/export locations

data.message: Enable Windows build. (#159)

data.author: Jacob Perron
data.message:
Fix QoS initialization from RMW QoS profile (#158)

Passing the RMW QoS struct to rclcpp::QoSInitialization::from_rmw does not copy
all of the QoS settings. Instead, it only copies the settings required for
initialization. To properly initialize with all custom QoS settings, pass the
RMW struct as the second argument.

Signed-off-by: Jacob Perron <jacob@openrobotics.org>

camera_info_manager port (#94)

* Reenable logging.

* Truly remove boost.

data.message:
Camera Calibration Parsers Port (#105)

* [cc_parsers] Remove COLCON_IGNORE.

* [cc_parsers] Uncrustify existing code.

* [cc_parsers] Rough port to ROS2.

* [cc_parsers] Proper ament exporting.

* Replace boost::spirit with simple parser.

* Write roundtrip tests for INI and YML.

* Completely remove Boost dependency.

* Fix Windows build.

* Fix Windows DLL and some of the linters.

* Mark NOLINT.

* Fix missing std::filesystem bits on MacOS.

* Extra braces to suppress MacOS warnings.

* Handle tmpnam_s errors.

data.author: Michael Carroll
data.message:
Image Transport rework port in progress for review (#84)

* Remove boost where possible.

* ros::VoidPtr to std::shared_ptr<void>

* Conversions around boost where necessary.

* Ignore other packages for now.

* Basic ament_cmake port.

* Port camera_common.

* Port publisher.

* Convert subscriber.

* Port single_subscriber_publisher.

* Type updates.

VoidPtr -> std::shared_ptr<void>
sensor_msgs::Image -> sensor_msgs::msg::Image
sensor_msgs::ImageConstPtr -> sensor_msgs::msg::Image::ConstSharedPtr

* Replace queue_size and latch with qos.

* Implement simple subscriber and publisher.

* Refactor.

* Restore comments and naming.

* Fixup transport and add republisher back in.

* Add library export.

* Address reviewer feedback.

* Clean up a few warnings, remove boost headers.

* compile_definitions -> compile_options

* Reviewer feedback on necessary includes.

* Address comments about CMakeLists and package.

* Switch to RCLCPP loggers.

* ERROR -> FATAL where asserts were used.

* Add TODOs for ROS2 assert equivalents back.

* Added a TODO for getNumPublishers.

data.author: Vincent Rabaud
data.message:
Merge pull request #65 from kartikmohta/patch-1

Use Boost_LIBRARIES instead of Boost_PYTHON_LIBRARY

data.author: Kartik Mohta
data.message:
Use Boost_LIBRARIES instead of Boost_PYTHON_LIBRARY

This was causing issues when building with python3 since then
`Boost_PYTHON_LIBRARY` is not set, instead cmake sets
`Boost_PYTHON3_LIBRARY`. So instead of adding each library separately,
using `Boost_LIBRARIES` seems to be better. For reference, from the
cmake docs:
```
Boost_LIBRARIES        - Boost component libraries to be linked
Boost_<C>_LIBRARY      - Libraries to link for component <C>
```

data.author: Lukas Bulwahn
data.message:
address gcc6 build error in polled_camera

With gcc6, compiling fails with `stdlib.h: No such file or directory`,
as including '-isystem /usr/include' breaks with gcc6, cf.,
https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=70129.

This commit addresses this issue for this package in the same way
it was addressed in various other ROS packages. A list of related
commits and pull requests is at:

  https://github.com/ros/rosdistro/issues/12783

Signed-off-by: Lukas Bulwahn <lukas.bulwahn@oss.bmw-carit.de>

data.author: Vincent Rabaud
data.message:
Merge pull request #32 from xqms/fix_camera_subscriber_shutdown

image_transport: fix CameraSubscriber shutdown (circular shared_ptr ref)

data.author: Max Schwarz
data.message:
image_transport: fix CameraSubscriber shutdown (circular shared_ptr ref)

CameraSubscriber uses a private boost::shared_ptr to share an impl object
between copied instances. In CameraSubscriber::CameraSubscriber(), it
handed this shared_ptr to boost::bind() and saved the created wall timer
in the impl object, thus creating a circular reference. The impl object
was therefore never freed.

Fix that by passing a plain pointer to boost::bind().
